_comment: This data is an early work-in-progress and contains errors. Produced by @michaelh at Discuss and Discover SuttaCentral forum - please get in touch! Finished code forthcoming.

The path that leads to the unconditioned: Serenity
Discernment
Immersion with placing the mind and keeping it connected
Immersion without placing the mind, but just keeping it connected
Immersion without placing the mind or keeping it connected
Emptiness immersion
Signless immersion
Undirected immersion
Meditating by observing an aspect of the body
Meditating by observing an aspect of feelings
Meditating by observing an aspect of the mind
Meditating by observing an aspect of principles
Generating enthusiasm, trying, making an effort, exerting the mind, and striving so that bad, unskillful qualities donâ€™t arise
Generating enthusiasm, trying, making an effort, exerting the mind, and striving so that bad, unskillful qualities are given up
Generating enthusiasm, trying, making an effort, exerting the mind, and striving so that skillful qualities arise

Generating enthusiasm, trying, making an effort, exerting the mind, and striving so that skillful qualities that have arisen remain, are not lost, but increase, mature, and are fulfilled by development
Developing the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to enthusiasm, and active effort
Developing the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to energy
Developing the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to mental development
Developing the basis of psychic power that has immersion due to inquiry, and active effort
Developing the faculty of faith, which relies on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripens as letting go
Developing the faculty of energy
Developing the faculty of mindfulness
Developing the faculty of immersion
Developing the faculty of wisdom, which relies on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripens as letting go

Developing the awakening factor of investigation of principles
